reading_passages.title: About The Human World
reading_passages.text: The human world encompasses all aspects of human society and how people interact with their environment. It includes population patterns, cultural practices, economic activities, and political systems. Human geography examines how people organize themselves across Earth's surface and how they modify their environment to meet their needs. Understanding the human world helps us comprehend the complex relationships between people and places.

reading_passages.title: Human Systems
reading_passages.text: Human systems include cultural, economic, political, and urban frameworks that organize society. Cultural systems encompass language, religion, customs, and traditions that define different groups. Economic systems determine how resources are allocated and goods are produced and distributed. Political systems establish governance structures and boundaries. Urban systems shape how cities develop and function. These systems interact with each other and with the physical environment in complex ways.

scientific_phenomena.title: The Human World Population
scientific_phenomena.description: Human population is distributed unevenly across Earth's surface, with concentrations in areas with favorable climate, resources, and historical development. Population growth, density, and movement are influenced by birth rates, death rates, and migration patterns.
observation_prompts: What population patterns can you identify in The Human World?
How might population density affect quality of life in different regions?
What patterns do you notice about population distribution in relation to physical geography?

scientific_phenomena.title: The Human World Urbanization
scientific_phenomena.description: Urbanization is the process by which an increasing percentage of a population lives in cities. This global trend has accelerated in recent centuries, creating megacities, urban sprawl, and new challenges for infrastructure and services.
observation_prompts: What urbanization features can you identify in The Human World?
How might urbanization affect the environment and natural resources?
What patterns do you notice about urban development in different regions?
